section.heading: Standing to Challenge.
section.text: A challenge to any part of the recount may be made by any person with standing to file a petition for the recount being conducted, even if that person was not the one who filed the actual petition.

section.heading: Basis for Challenge.
section.text: A challenge may be based on an action or decision of the local board during the recount.

para.text: To Election Director. If a person seeks to challenge some action then being taken, the person may ask the election director to temporarily stop the action so that the person can interpose a challenge.
Reasons To Be Given. In all events, the person making the challenge shall state the reason for the challenge.
Marking Ballot. If the challenge is to a ballot, the official whose action has been challenged shall:
Count the vote as the official believes proper; and
Set it aside with an attached notation on:
The name of the official; and
Board To Decide Promptly. The board shall decide the challenge promptly and expeditiously so as not to delay the recount.
Standards. A vote may not be disallowed except by unanimous vote of all board members.
Board Decision Final. The decision of the board is final.
